title: Model Theft
description: Model theft occurs when proprietary models are copied, reverse-engineered, or extracted without authorization. Attackers can use model extraction attacks, API abuse, or unauthorized access to steal model weights, architecture, or training data.
detection_patterns: Model exposed via API without protection
No access controls on model endpoints
No rate limiting on model queries

mitigations.implementation: Use authentication, authorization, rate limiting, and monitor for suspicious access patterns that indicate extraction attempts.
Implement API keys, authentication tokens, IP allowlisting, and detect anomalous query patterns.
Add noise to outputs, limit response precision, and use output rounding to make extraction more difficult.
Monitor for extraction patterns such as large numbers of diverse queries, systematic exploration, or unusual access patterns.
Use terms of service, licensing agreements, and legal measures to protect intellectual property.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM10: Model Theft
